text: hi I'm Stephanie Jaworski of joy baking
calm today we're going to make pastry
cream which is really a thick rich
custard the first thing we need to do is
to take one and a quarter cups that's
about 300 milliliters of milk you can
use either whole or I'm using 2% and
just put that in a saucepan and then
what we're going to do is take a vanilla
bean just a half now if you don't have a
vanilla bean because they are quite
expensive you can just use instead one
teaspoon of pure vanilla extract or
better yet a teaspoon of vanilla bean
paste which is like a thick vanilla
extract but it has the beans so you get
the look of using a vanilla bean but
it's a lot easier and cheaper to use but
if you're using a vanilla bean what you
need to do is take a sharp knife and
just cut halfway cut the bean in half
but kids still keep it intact like so so
that way as the milk heats up the beans
the little tiny seeds will be released
into the milk
so put that together and just we're
going to heat this just until boiling
still until it just starts to foam up so
put a medium medium-high heat
so as that heats up in a separate bowl
I'm going to place three large egg yolks
that I brought to room temperature and
I'm going to add to that a quarter cup
which is 50 grams of granulated white
sugar and just stir that together to
make a paste and then to that I'm just
going to add like a pinch of salt about
an eighth of a teaspoon I like to use a
kosher salt and then I'm going to just
sift over the top two tablespoons that's
20 grams of just regular white
all-purpose flour and two tablespoons
that's about 20 grams of cornstarch or
maybe you know that is corn flour so I'm
just going to sift that over top and
stir this in now you want to do this
step while you're heating your milk
because you don't want it to sit too
long with the eggs there coz it get
lumpy so just do this as a milks heating
so this becomes a really nice thick
paste
okay so that's ready
now once the milk heats up we're going
to whisk it in gradually into that egg
mixture so our milk is just starting to
boil it foam up so I'm just going to
remove from the heat and what you want
to do is gradually whisk in slowly the
milk into the egg mixture so I'm just
going to add a little you don't want to
add it all at once or the eggs will
curdle so I'm just going to add a little
to loosen it up see and then I'm just
going to add it with the would keep
whisking in a steady stream this way
well curdle and you get a nice smooth
mixture if you did find you had a little
curdling then just strain your your
mixture once you've finished to get rid
of any lumps that may have formed don't
whisk in the students see I get the
vanilla bean still in the pot so just
whisk it it's called you added a little
at the beginning which is tempering and
then so there now what I want to do
we're going to heat that but first I'm
going to remove that vanilla bean and
then with the sharp knife just going to
split that open where I had cut it and
I'm just going to remove just the on
tape let's remove all the seeds
that'll give us that really nice those
little flecks in the finish screen I'm
just going to add that now don't throw
this vanilla pod out just wash it off
dry it and then put it in your sugar
bowl and then that will leave it there
for about a week and it will send all of
your sugar really nice vanilla flavor
which you can then use in your baking as
you would have ordinary yeah sure so
what I'm now going to do is pour it back
in the pot and then we're going to put
this back on the stove just over medium
heat because what we want to do now is
thicken this the flour and the
cornstarch will thicken the cream so I'm
just going to have it on medium heat now
what you want to do is whisk constantly
because we don't want the eggs to curl
and we're going to bring it just to a
boil and then we're just going to keep
stirring for about thirty to sixty
seconds just until it starts to thicken
again if you do find you have some lumps
just strain it after we're finished and
then that'll get rid of any of those
okay so as you can see it's nice and
thick so but what you're looking for
like mayonnaise I guess you could say
you see that's what you're looking for
and then just remove it from the heat
and then pour it into a clean Bowl now
if you didn't use the vanilla bean if
you are going to add the vanilla extract
now is when you would stir it in and if
you like you can also add which I'm
going to add a half a tablespoon to 3/4
of a tablespoon of liquor you can use
Grand Marnier is very nice a brandy I'm
going to use a con yak here just adds a
nice flavor and just stir it in yeah
and that's it now pastry cream is a
really nice filling for the fruit tart
the Boston cream pie it's used for
eclairs Napoleon's all sorts of things
so now immediately after you make this
take a piece of plastic wrap and just
press it on right onto the surface of
the cream and that will prevent a skin
from forming on the top of the cream so
just let it cool like that to room
temperature and then you can use it for
say to fill your fruit tart or you could
just then put it in the refrigerator for
two to three days and then if you're
going to refrigerate this take a whisk
and then whisk it before using because
to get rid of any lumps so until next
time I'm Stefanie Jaworski of joy baking
calm
